snippet: Hurricane Sandy has again raised the question of whether the city should armor itself against storm surges, but Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg has expressed wariness about whether sea gates would work.
abstract: Hurricane Sandy once again raises the question of whether the city should arm itself against storm surges, but Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg has expressed wariness about whether mobile sea gates, which would cost at least $10 billion to $17 billion to install, would provide adequate protection.
lead_paragraph: Hurricane Sandy has again raised the question of whether the city should armor itself against storm surges, but Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg has expressed wariness about whether sea gates would work.

headline.seo: After Hurricane Sandy, Debating Costly Sea Barriers in New York Area
headline.main: Weighing Sea Barriers as Protection for New York
headline.print_headline: Weighing Sea Barriers as Protection for New York City
